description.p: A test sample of Inventive Example 4 was produced similarly as in Inventive Example 3, except that the coating weight of the bead-containing coating layer was made to be 2 g/m2 in terms of weight after drying.
description.heading: (Inventive Example 5): from the barcode reading side: (25 µm-thick PET / bead-containing coating layer / barcode print):
description.p: In Inventive Example 5, on a back side (opposite from the barcode reading side) of a 25 µm-thick transparent polyethylene terephthalate film (PET), nitrocellulose having melamine beads of an average particle diameter of 5 µm dispersed therein in an amount of 15 wt% in terms of solid content was applied as a coating, so as to be 2 g/m2 in terms of weight after drying. After drying the coating, on the surface of the coating, a barcode of a barcode size (nominal 0.200 mm/module) was provided by gravure printing using a gravure printing plate, by using a black ink (matrix resin: nitrocellulose; contains 16 wt% carbon black pigment in terms of solid content), so as to be about 1.5 µm in terms of thickness after drying. In this manner, a test sample of Inventive Example 5 was produced. The bead-containing coating layer was almost transparent.
description.heading: (Evaluation Test 1)
description.p:
The above-described specimens were subjected to a barcode readability evaluation test by a barcode verifier.
As the barcode verifier (barcode readability evaluating device) for evaluating the readability of a barcode, TruCheck 401-RL manufactured by MUNAZO Co., Ltd. was used (where scanning was performed ten times). Test samples of Inventive Examples 1 to 5 and Comparative Examples 1 and 2 were each placed on a body of an empty ampoule (colorless and transparent glass injection vial; 14 mm in diameter x 76 mm in length), with the barcode reading side facing outside (see Fig. 10). The aforementioned evaluating device was used to scan the barcode portions to measure the following evaluation items: SC value (symbol contrast (Rmax-Rmin), unit: %), EDGE (edge determination), R1 (maximum reflectance), Rd (minimum reflectance), MinEC (minimum edge contrast, unit: %), MOD (modulation, unit: %), Def (defects, unit: %), DCD (decode), DEC (decodability, unit: %), and MinQZ (minimum quiet zone). The results of the evaluation of these items as well as the overall evaluation are shown in Table 11. It is noted that the score ranges of the classes (levels) of the overall evaluation in Table 11 (in compliance with the American National Standards Institute (ANSI)) are as shown in Table 2 above.

According to Table 11, in Comparative Examples 1 and 2 both containing no beads, the SC value was 10 to 20 and the overall evaluation was "F", with a poor reading accuracy. In contrast, the results of Inventive Examples 1 to 5 showed the SC values of 111 to 118 and the evaluation classes of "A" to "B", indicating a considerable improvement in reading accuracy as compared with the Comparative Examples. The improvement in barcode readability according to the present invention is obvious. Moreover, the laminates were almost transparent except the barcode portions, allowing visual observations of the contents of the ampoules, thereby ensuring good visibility.
description.heading: (Evaluation Test 2)
description.p: The specimens of Comparative Example 1 and Inventive Examples 2 and 4 were each placed on a body of an ampoule (similar to that used in Evaluation Test 1) filled with water, with the barcode reading side facing outside. The aforementioned evaluating device was used to scan the barcode portions to measure the SC value and other evaluation items. The results are shown in Table 12, where the effects of the present invention are obvious. The barcodes were able to be read with no problem even when the containers were filled with water. Further, it was readily possible to observe that there is no foreign matter in the water.
description.heading: (Evaluation Test 3)
description.p: The evaluation items were measured similarly as in Evaluation Test 2, except that water in the ampoule was replaced with green tea (of light green). The specimens used were of Comparative Example 1 and Inventive Examples 2 and 4. The results are shown in Table 13, where the effects of the present invention are obvious. The barcodes were able to be read with no problem even if the containers were filled with green tea. Further, it was readily possible to observe tea leaves left in the tea.
description.heading: (Evaluation Test 4)
description.p: The evaluation items were measured similarly as in Evaluation Test 2, except that water in the ampoule was replaced with commercially available liquid yogurt (of white). The specimens used were of Comparative Example 1 and Inventive Examples 2 and 4. The results are shown in Table 14, where the effects of the present invention are obvious. The barcodes were able to be read with no problem even if the containers were filled with yogurt.
description.heading: (Evaluation Test 5)
description.p: The evaluation items were measured similarly as in Evaluation Test 2, except that water in the ampoule was replaced with commercially available cola (of almost black). The specimens used were of Comparative Example 1 and Inventive Examples 2 and 4. The results are shown in Table 15, where the effects of the present invention are obvious. The barcodes were able to be read with no problem even if the containers were filled with cola.
description.heading: (Evaluation Test 6)
description.p: The evaluation items were measured similarly as in Evaluation Test 2, except that water in the ampoule was replaced with commercially available gargle (trade name: "Isodine") (of dark brown). The specimens used were of Comparative Example 1 and Inventive Examples 2 and 4. The results are shown in Table 16, where the effects of the present invention are obvious. The barcodes were able to be read with no problem even if the containers were filled with gargle.
description.heading: (Evaluation Test 7)
description.p: The evaluation items were measured similarly as in Evaluation Test 1, except that the colorless and transparent glass ampoule was replaced with a brown glass ampoule. The specimens used were of Comparative Example 1 and Inventive Examples 2 and 4. The results are shown in Table 17, where the effects of the present invention are obvious. The barcodes were able to be read with no problem even in the case of the brown containers.

In any of the above-described evaluation tests, the barcode readability was poor in those other than the Inventive Examples, even if the object used was visible from the outside. This shows that only those of the present invention are able to assure good readability of the barcode and high visibility of the used object together.

While the embodiments and examples of the present invention have been described above, it should be understood that the embodiments and examples disclosed above are only illustrative and that the scope of the present invention is not restricted to those embodiments. The scope of the present invention is defined by the terms of the claims, and is intended to include any modifications within the scope and meaning equivalent to the terms of the claims.
description.heading: Industrial Applicability
description.p: The laminate and others of the present invention each enable a compact and high-density barcode to be read with accuracy by using a commercially available barcode reader, whereby their contributions to the quality control and others in this field are expected. They are particularly useful in preventing drug mix-ups, managing expiration dates, preventing counterfeiting, and others.
description.heading: Description of the Reference Characters
description.p: 1: base material; 3: white-colored layer; 5: barcode print; 7: bead-containing coating layer (undercoat layer); 7a: resin; 7b: bead; 7f: soft bead; 7k: hard bead; 10: laminate; 17: thermal adhesive layer, self-adhesive agent, etc.; 25: ampoule; and 30: label.

claim.claim-text: Laminat (10) mit einer farbigen Barcodedrucklage (5), einer Basismateriallage (1) einschließlich einer metallischen Dünnfilmlage und einer kugelhaltigen Beschichtungslage (7), dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die kugelhaltige Beschichtungslage zumindest Kunststoffkugeln enthält.
Laminat (10) gemäß Anspruch 1, wobei die Kunststoffkugeln innerhalb des Matrixkunststoffes (7a) dispergiert sind, der die kugelhaltige Beschichtungslage (7) bildet.

Laminat (10) gemäß Anspruch 2, wobei die Barcodedrucklage (5) zumindest an einem Teil der Basismateriallage (1) positioniert ist und die kugelhaltige Beschichtungslage (7) so positioniert ist, dass sie die Barcodedrucklage (5) abdeckt.
Laminat (10) gemäß einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 3, wobei die kugelhaltige Beschichtungslage (7) des Weiteren zumindest Glaskugeln, Metalloxidkugeln oder Metallkugeln enthält.
Laminat (10) gemäß Anspruch 4, wobei die Kugeln innerhalb der kugelhaltigen Beschichtungslage (7) aus Kunststoffkugeln und Glaskugeln zusammengesetzt sind.
Laminat (10) gemäß Anspruch 4 oder 5, wobei die kugelhaltige Beschichtungslage (7) des Weiteren Metalloxidpartikel enthält.
Laminat (10) gemäß Anspruch 6, wobei die Metalloxidpartikel aus Quarz ausgebildet sind.
Laminat (10) gemäß Anspruch 5, wobei die Glaskugeln einen durchschnittlichen Partikeldurchmesser haben, der größer ist als jener der Kunststoffkugeln.

Laminat (10) gemäß Anspruch 1, wobei die kugelhaltige Beschichtungslage (7) in Kontakt mit zumindest einem Teil der Basismateriallage (1) positioniert ist, und die Barcodedrucklage (5) an und in Kontakt mit zumindest einem Teil der kugelhaltigen Beschichtungslage (7) positioniert ist.
Laminat (10) gemäß Anspruch 9, wobei die kugelhaltige Beschichtungslage (7) des Weiteren zumindest Glaskugeln, Metalloxidkugeln oder Metallkugeln enthält.
Laminat (10) gemäß Anspruch 10, wobei die Kugeln innerhalb der kugelhaltigen Beschichtungslage (7) aus Kunststoffkugeln und Glaskugeln zusammengesetzt sind.
Laminat (10) gemäß Anspruch 10 oder 11, wobei die kugelhaltige Beschichtungslage (7) des Weiteren Metalloxidpartikel enthält.
Laminat (10) gemäß Anspruch 12, wobei die Metalloxidpartikel aus Quarz ausgebildet sind.
Laminat (10) gemäß Anspruch 11, wobei die Glaskugeln einen durchschnittlichen Partikeldurchmesser haben, der größer ist als jener der Kunststoffkugeln.
Laminat (10) gemäß einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 14, wobei die Basismateriallage (1) eine Heißklebelage (17) enthält.
Laminat (10) gemäß einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 15, wobei die Kugeln, die innerhalb der kugelhaltigen Beschichtungslage (7) enthalten sind, transparent oder semi-transparent sind.

Laminat (10) gemäß einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 16, wobei die Kugeln, die innerhalb der kugelhaltigen Beschichtungslage (7) enthalten sind, einen durchschnittlichen Partikeldurchmesser von 0,1 µm bis 30 µm haben.
Packung, die das Laminat (10) gemäß einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 17 aufweist.
Packungsblatt mit dem Laminat (10) gemäß einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 17.
Packungsmaterial, das das Laminat (10) gemäß einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 17 aufweist.

A laminate (10) comprising a colored barcode print layer (5), a base material layer (1) including a metallic thin film layer, and a bead-containing coating layer (7), characterized in that said bead-containing coating layer includes at least resin beads.
The laminate (10) according to claim 1, wherein said resin beads are dispersed within the matrix resin (7a) constituting said bead-containing coating layer (7).

The laminate (10) according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the barcode print layer (5) is positioned on at least a part of the base material layer (1), and the bead-containing coating layer (7) is positioned to cover the barcode print layer (5).
The laminate (10) according to any of claims 1 to 3, wherein said bead-containing coating layer (7) further includes at least one of glass beads, metal oxide beads, and metal beads.
The laminate (10) according to claim 4, wherein the beads within said bead-containing coating layer (7) are composed of resin beads and glass beads.
The laminate (10) according to claim 4 or 5, wherein the bead-containing coating layer (7) further includes metal oxide particles.
The laminate (10) according to claim 6, wherein the metal oxide particles are formed of silica.
The laminate (10) according to claim 5, wherein said glass beads have an average particle diameter greater than that of said resin beads.

The laminate (10) according to claim 1, wherein the bead-containing coating layer (7) is positioned in contact with at least a part of the base material layer (1) and the barcode print layer (5) is positioned on and in contact with at least a part of the bead-containing coating layer (7).
The laminate (10) according to claim 9, wherein the bead-containing coating layer (7) further includes at least any one of glass beads, metal oxide beads and metal beads.
The laminate (10) according to claim 10, wherein the beads within said bead-containing coating layer (7) are composed of resin beads and glass beads.
The laminate (10) according to claim 10 or 11, wherein the bead-containing coating layer (7) further includes metal oxide particles.
The laminate (10) according to claim 12, wherein the metal oxide particles are formed of silica.
The laminate (10) according to claim 11, wherein said glass beads have an average particle diameter greater than that of said resin beads.
The laminate (10) according to any of claims 1 to 14, wherein the base material layer (1) includes a thermal adhesive layer (17).
The laminate (10) according to any of claims 1 to 15, wherein the beads included within said bead-containing coating layer (7) are transparent or semi-transparent.
The laminate (10) according to any of claims 1 to 16, wherein the beads included within said bead-containing coating layer (7) have an average particle diameter of 0.1 µm to 30 µm.
A package comprising the laminate (10) according to any of claims 1 to 17.
A packaging sheet comprising the laminate (10) according to any of claims 1 to 17.
A packaging material comprising the laminate (10) according to any of claims 1 to 17.

Stratifié (10) comprenant une couche d'impression de code à barres coloré (5), une couche de matériau de base (1) comprenant une couche de mince film métallique, et une couche de revêtement contenant des billes (7), caractérisé en ce que ladite couche de revêtement contenant des billes comprend au moins des billes de résine.
Stratifié (10) selon la revendication 1, dans lequel lesdites billes de résine sont dispersées dans une résine matricielle (7a) constituant ladite couche de revêtement contenant des billes (7).

Stratifié (10) selon la revendication 1 ou 2, dans lequel la couche d'impression de code à barres (5) est positionnée sur au moins une partie de la couche de matériau de base (1), et la couche de revêtement contenant des billes (7) est positionnée de manière à recouvrir la couche d'impression de code à barres (5).

Stratifié (10) selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 3, dans lequel ladite couche de revêtement contenant des billes (7) comprend en outre au moins l'une de billes de verre, de billes d'oxyde métallique et de billes métalliques.
Stratifié (10) selon la revendication 4, dans lequel les billes dans ladite couche de revêtement contenant des billes (7) sont composées de billes de résine et de billes de verre.
Stratifié (10) selon la revendication 4 ou 5, dans lequel la couche de revêtement contenant des billes (7) comprend en outre des particules d'oxyde métallique.
Stratifié (10) selon la revendication 6, dans lequel les particules d'oxyde métallique sont formées de silice.
Stratifié (10) selon la revendication 5, dans lequel lesdites billes de verre ont un diamètre de particule moyen supérieur à celui desdites billes de résine.

Stratifié (10) selon la revendication 1, dans lequel la couche de revêtement contenant des billes (7) est positionnée en contact avec au moins une partie de la couche de matériau de base (1) et la couche d'impression de code à barres (5) est positionnée sur au moins une partie de la couche de revêtement contenant des billes (7) et en contact avec celle-ci.

Stratifié (10) selon la revendication 9, dans lequel la couche de revêtement contenant des billes (7) comprend en outre au moins l'une quelconque de billes de verre, de billes d'oxyde métallique et de billes métalliques.
Stratifié (10) selon la revendication 10, dans lequel les billes dans ladite couche de revêtement contenant des billes (7) sont composées de billes de résine et de billes de verre.
Stratifié (10) selon la revendication 10 ou 11, dans lequel la couche de revêtement contenant des billes (7) comprend en outre des particules d'oxyde métallique.
Stratifié (10) selon la revendication 12, dans lequel les particules d'oxyde métallique sont formées de silice.
Stratifié (10) selon la revendication 11, dans lequel lesdites billes de verre ont un diamètre de particule moyen supérieur à celui desdites billes de résine.
Stratifié (10) selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 14, dans lequel la couche de matériau de base (1) comprend une couche thermoadhésive (17).
Stratifié (10) selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 15, dans lequel les billes incluses dans ladite couche de revêtement contenant des billes (7) sont transparentes ou semi-transparentes.

Stratifié (10) selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 16, dans lequel les billes incluses dans ladite couche de revêtement contenant des billes (7) ont un diamètre de particule moyen de 0,1 µm à 30 µm.
Emballage comprenant le stratifié (10) selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 17.
Feuille d'emballage comprenant le stratifié (10) selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 17.
Matériau d'emballage comprenant le stratifié (10) selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 17.
